Detailed Description

A basic dialog that provides typical buttons found on most DAZ Studio dialogs.

The buttons provided by the dialog are: 'What's This', 'Apply', 'Accept',and 'Cancel'. Custom buttons can also be added to the set of default buttons by calling addButton(). All buttons but the 'Accept' button can be hidden or shown. By default, the 'Apply' button is the only hidden button. The text on the default buttons can be customized.

The dialog has a vertical box layout above the horizontal set of buttons. Widgets and sub-layouts can be added to this layout using addWidget() and addLayout().

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzBasicDialog::DzBasicDialog ( QWidget *  parent,
const QString &  name 
)

Default Constructor. Creates a typical DAZ Studio dialog with 'What's This', 'Apply', 'Accept', and 'Cancel' buttons. By default, the 'Apply' button is hidden, call enableApplyButton() to make it visible.

Parameters:
parent The parent widget for the dialog. Typically this should be the main window, or the currently active modal dialog.
name The object name for the widget.
DzBasicDialog::~DzBasicDialog (  )  [virtual]

Destructor

Member Function Documentation

void DzBasicDialog::accept (  )  [protected, virtual]

Reimplemented from QDialog. When the user clicks the 'Accept' button, this calls apply() and closes the dialog.

void DzBasicDialog::apply (  )  [protected, virtual, slot]

Virtual function called when the user clicks the 'Apply' or 'Accept' button. Subclasses should reimplement this to apply their data.

bool DzBasicDialog::event ( QEvent *  e  )  [protected]

Reimplemented from QObject to restore dialog geometries on show events.

Reimplemented in DzNodeDlg.

void DzBasicDialog::reject (  )  [protected, virtual]

Reimplemented from QDialog. When the user clicks the 'Cancel' button, this closes the dialog.

void DzBasicDialog::restoreGeometryState (  )  [protected, slot]

This method restores the dialog's geometry state (size, position) from a previously stored state.

In order for this functionality to work, a DzBasicDialog instance needs to have a unique name (as passed in the constructor). Also, if sub-classes provide over-ridden accept() or reject() methods, they must call the base DzBasicDialog versions of those methods.

See also:
saveGeometryState()
void DzBasicDialog::saveGeometryState (  )  [protected, slot]

This method saves the dialog's geometry state (size, position) so that the next time the dialog is shown it can be restored to the state it was in previously.

See also:
restoreGeometryState()
void DzBasicDialog::setAcceptButtonEnabled ( bool  onOff  ) 

Enables or disables the Accept button. By default, the button is enabled.

Parameters:
onOff If true, the 'Accept' button will be available to the user. If false, the button will not be shown.
void DzBasicDialog::setAcceptButtonText ( const QString &  text  ) 

Sets the text for the dialog's accept button. By default, the button is labelled 'Accept'.

void DzBasicDialog::whatsThis (  )  [protected, virtual, slot]

Virtual function called when the user clicks the 'What's This' button. The default implementation puts the application in What's This mode.
